Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Phil L
Reviews.Content: The Cavalieri was a perfect little place to stay in Rome. Just two blocks from the Colosseum, the Roman Ruins, the Roman Forum, and Palatine Hill, and an easy walk to the Ancient Center. A metro stop is located at the Colosseum to get to places north as well as to the Vatican. The hotel is very clean and located in a quiet neighborhood. The staff was very friendly and the front desk easily managed special requests (extra blankets/taxi to the airport). You can't beat the value while in Rome. Breakfast consisted of scrambled eggs, an assortment of fruits and pastries, yogurt, coffee, juice and tea. There is also a roof top deck where you can enjoy a bottle of wine in the evening, but considering the hotel is nestled in the middle of a block, the view from the roof is limited.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: rnew06
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel walking distance to the colosseum. The hotel is nothing special but for the price it is worth it. They serve a nice breakfast in the morning and the staff is very helpful. However there are a few very good restaurants right around the corner from the hotel that made the stay a little bit special. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: PerBaad
Reviews.Content: As being 10th time visitor in Rome, we changed hotel. Hotel Cavalieri is recommendable, quiet surroundings, helpful staff and good rooms. The hotel is situated close to Coloseum and only a short walk from the tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position, just needed more air con...”
Reviews.Author: KristyW_79
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed for 3 nights prior to a cruise and needed a hotel within walking distance of many of the major sights in Rome. This hotel fit the bill. The Colosseum, Roman and Imperial Forums are in the immediate vicinity. We also visited the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and Piazza Navona by foot one afternoon. We often got back in the late afternoon and headed out for dinner later in the evening (8:30/9:00pm), so it was also handy that there were seveal cafes and restaurants nearby - one is only10m down the street, well priced and has fantastic food. So, position-wise we could not have asked for better. The room was smaller than we had expected, but it wasn't really tiny or cramped. There was a Queen bed (I think), a very comfortable lounge and a smaller chair. The wardrobe space was large enough, but we didn't unpack anyway. The bathroom is spacious enough and the water pressure is great. We never had any trouble getting hot water (very important). A bonus for our room was that we had our own balcony/verandah - it was on two large levels and had a nice little table and chairs set. We also checked out the rooftop terrace. It was good for catching a breeze in the heat of the day. Our only gripe with our room was the air conditioning - as you had to keep your key in the slot for the power to work, we always had to come back to a hot room and, though we would turn it down to its coldest setting and up to its highest fan level, it struggled to do more than take the edge off the heat. We could see it was quite an old unit, so maybe an upgrade to newer equipment would fix this one problem. Breakfast was included in the room price and we enjoyed it. It isn't the full on buffet you may find in the more expensive hotels, but there is a decent selection of food - bacon, sausages, eggs, cereal, pastries, cheese and cold meats - and they will make you a cup of whatever coffee you prefer (not just poured out of a pot, but brewed on a proper barista machine), or provide juice if you prefer. One morning we were being picked up for a tour before breakfast started, and they were kind enough to let us grab a few pastries to take with us. Reception was manned 24 hours by several different people, all of whom were pleasant and helpful. We had no problems with any of the staff. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay somewhere central to the ancient sites. If you don't expect the Hilton, you should be satisfied with the level of accomodation provided, and enjoy the friendliness rather than false deference from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrottingChris
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here recently for two nights. The rooms were adequate - small but clean. Our bathroom was tiny but my mother's bathroom was spacious. The location is great - just a short walk from the Coloseum and Foro Romano. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There are several lovely restaurants nearby as well. The rooftop terrace was lovely at night. I wish the rooms were a bit larger but for the price it really is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a weekend in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: HEK293
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over an extended weekend in Rome. The room was quite spaceous and clean. The hotel is located on a quiet (for Rome anyway) side street but very close to the sights. The Colloseum is right around the corner. The hotel has a roof terrace on the fourth floor which is nice in the evening. Last but not least - the staff were english speaking and very helpful! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel on fantastic location next to the forum”
Reviews.Author: waldorf15
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a wekend in this hotel and had a very good time. The room was small, but all you need is a bed and a bathroom, really. Both were there. Own balcony was a nice addition, but I think not all rooms have them. It is situated in a small street at 75 metres from the Forum, which makes this a perfect place to explore the Eternal City from. Breakfast was good with a wide range of cereals, bread, eggs, fruit, etc to choose from every morning. The staff are very helpful and will give you a some nice ideas for visits or trips in the city. the only drawback was an airconditioning unit outside, making it necessary to keep the window closed at night. This might be annoying in the warmer months.

Reviews.Title: “Would not come back”
Reviews.Author: travelling006
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, location is excellent. Close to colloseum and forum romanum hidden away in a small street. Rooms are ok but nit great. Hardly no lighting in the room, shower is old and wearing off. Great plus is that there is skytv - internet is available if you pay..but didnt work half the time we were there. Rooms are very small and not soundproof at all. I could hear all neighbouring rooms coming in late at night or waking up!! Doors are also not soundproof, you hear pple in tge corridors all tge time. Breakfast is not great, breakfast room is old fashioned and needa to be renewed. I would only come back for the location of thishotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaM83
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay! This was my second time in Rome and location of this hotel was absolutely great. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and big. Definitely recommend staying here and will stay here myself for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: NancyT007
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. It is in a great location if you're looking to explore Ancient Rome, which we were. The Colosseum, Roman Forum, Palatine Hill, Trevi Fountain etc., are within a reasonable walking distance. The Vatican was a bit of a trek (we took the bus), but even that was okay. The room was nice, and had a large bathroom. It is in a quiet area, which is great for sleeping. Two of the best features of the hotel are the adjustable air conditioning and satellite television. It was great for us Canadians to be able to get in out of the heat, and relax after a long day with some English language television, LOL. There is a great breakfast served each morning (croissants, yogurts, muffins, coffee etc.). Not what we're used to in North America, but still tasty. Finally, and most importantly to me, the staff was absolutely lovely. We had forgotten to print out our Internet-purchased Colosseum tickets, and the front desk staff let me use their computer and printer to get them. Such an understanding bunch! Everyone was all smiles and ready to help you as best they could. Thank you so much to the Hotel Fori Imperiali Cavalieri for a wonderful stay! :o) Nancy and Jason

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: elizatravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel for 4 days. The location is excellent, very close to Colloseum and Colleseo metro station. The room was small, but clean and serviced every day. Breakfast more than ample, but the tables are very small and space is a problem, Paolo at Reception desk is a superstar and without his excellent knowledge we would have been lost more than once. If you are looking for affordable, clean hotel this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Value, Perfect Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Formum
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay - what a holiday!! The hotel is small, clean and friendly. Breakfast buffet is good - lovely coffee and very smiley Waiter - excellent value. Towels changed every day, beds every other day - more like a 4* than a 3. The rooms and bathroom are small but well equipped and extremely clean. All the staff were very pleasant and helpful. Location: Excellent - 5 min stroll from the Coliseum - at the city centre side, off a main street and extremely quiet at night. Would definitely visit again. Brilliant Hotel - Fabulous City.

Reviews.Title: “First choice for a short break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bobjob21
Reviews.Content: I can totally recommend this hotel. It proved to be perfect for a short break in Rome for seeing all the major sights. Its location is ideal; in walking distance of pretty much everything, even the Vatican if you are fit. The attitude of the staff is marvellous and the room was high quality and very quiet, which was welcome as walking around Rome is very tiring. We were particularly impressed with the receptionist who helped us with taxis and made us a cup of tea for nothing late at night – very much appreciated. At 130 Euros per night it was competitive for Rome, and we had a very large room for a Rome hotel (302 - I believe it was actually a quad room). The breakfast was excellent and large enough to keep you going until lunchtime. The nearby restaurants (Iaro and La Piazzeta) looked scruffy and touristy, but served great food. The latter stocks a really top quality Pinot Grigio at 20 Euros. The rooms have aircon and hotel has a roof terrace (though it was raining the night we went up there). If I return to Rome the Hotel Fori Imperiali Cavalieri would certainly be my first choice. One tip on the local restaurants by the way: those recommended on Trip Advisor were all booked up when we visited. You need to reserve in advance if you want to visit the top places. From our experience I would say you don’t need to: Italians simply don’t serve bad food, so it doesn’t matter so much where you go.

Reviews.Title: “A small central, yet quite, friendly hotel with roof top terrace.”
Reviews.Author: purpleTerry
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a quite side street yet very close to the forum and colosseum. The rooms were small but very clean and cool due to good air conditioning. The staff were friendly, especially the nice man who does breakfast and made me a great espresso each morning. They have a nice roof top terrace where you can take a bottle from the local shop and enjoy an evening drink. While we were there most nights we were the only ones to take advantage of this and we sat and watch a light show on the side of the colosseum, well most of one as you can't see the whole colosseum from here, but it was a nice way to end an evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Roman ruins”
Reviews.Author: Whistler'smom
Reviews.Content: Our family of four, including two teenagers, stayed here for one night in August. As other reviewers have noted, the quad room is small - there is a queen bed in the center of the room with a twin bed a foot away on each side, There is no chair, table or desk. The bathroom is small. The shower is the size of a cruise ship shower and might be problematic for someone older or heavier. However, although the room might have been a bit small for our family for a week, it worked very well for us for one night. It probably would also work out well for a longer stay by a family with small children. The hotel was clean and very quiet. I am a light sleeper, but I slept very well. Breakfast was good. A few of the pastries were packaged, but most were good and there was a large selection of food. The coffee was very good. The best part was the location - near a metro stop, the Roman ruins and many, many cafes. I recommend arriving at the Coliseum early in the morning before the crowds and tour groups arrive, so having a hotel just a few blocks away is a big plus. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here if I were on a trip by myself or with one other person.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for busy city break.”
Reviews.Author: blondeblondeblonde6
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an amazing location with the Colosseum just a few minutes walk away! We had a lovely clean room with a balcony, and the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and quiet”
Reviews.Author: JillMadison
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the last two nights of our vacation in the hotel. The location is wonderful. We especially liked how quiet the hotel was -- only a few steps away from a busy and crowded area, but we were able to sleep well! Hotel staff were not overtly friendly, but when approached, were extremely helpful. Our room, though small, was ample, and the bathroom was very nice. My only complaint is that I could not get cell phone reception in the room, but that's minor. And, the price (a spring deal) was good, especially for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: coup
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the Hotel Nerva (see my review) but when the volcanic ash cloud extended our stay for 4 extra nights they wanted to put the rate up 30%. I searched on venere.com, found this hotel and walked round the corner to book it. It did not feel quite as welcoming but the location is as good, the rooms (and especially the bathrooms) are bigger and the buffet breakfast is excellent. Staff were friendly and everything was spotless. I cannot over-emphasize how much we enjoyed being in the heart of the Forum area. It is more extensive than I had expected and has an open aspect that makes much of the city seem cramped and noisy. Almost everything is in walking distance and the rest is a short one euro bus ride away. No need to have a hotel with a restaurant as there are plenty around every corner. Don't be put off by the cobbled street where this is located. It is safe and quiet with a view of the Colisseum down the next street. Only minor problem I had was that my iPod would not connect to the wi-fi in the room so I was back down in the lobby every day checking that damned cloud.....

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings...”
Reviews.Author: Julia_278
Reviews.Content: This hotel really left me with mixed feelings; right in the center of everything yet quiet enough, able to visit most of Rome's sights by foot (we only used the metro to go to the Vatican) and really close to the metro station for those who are not willing to walk as much as we did. The personel was helpful and curteous when we asked for information about restaurants and transportation, and I have no complaints about the cleanliness nor the breakfast (not a huge variety, but fresh, tasty and accompanied by a great coffee). Now, what I disliked: primerally the size of the room, the size of it being around 10m2. The room was much smaller than what you could imagine by the photos in their website. There was hardly any space to put our luggage and it felt very difficult to move around. Likely the bathroom was spaceous enough. Then, there was the lighting; being there in December when, even in Rome, there's not much sunshine, 2 reading lambs to each side of the bed and another one across on the wall were just not enough! And last, the towels were worn out, it doesn't cost much to update the linens every once in a while. To sum up, I can't say I'm disappointed by my stay and maybe I would stay there again in the future, as I am not looking for luxuries, just a clean room to sleep at the end of the day!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have picked a better LOCATION in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Mumsbolognese
Reviews.Content: Booked this on the internet as the last 2 nights of our Europe holiday, and selected based firstly on location (wanted something central to all of the action and tourist attractions - especially the Colosseum), then on affordability, room reviews, and overall bang for your buck. It's no secret that Rome is hideously expensive for accomodation, so our expectations were not high. This place was PERFECT for our needs - we have 2 young children, and the room was adequately sized with a Queen bed and two singles for the kids. Bathroom was compact but very pleasant and completely adequate, as well as well kitted out with the usual hotel room giveaways like shampoo, soap, shoe polish, shower caps. We were on the 2nd floor (accessed by lift) with a view over the main entrance courtyard. Walk less than 20 seconds from the entrance and you are in full view of the Colosseum. Everywhere we wanted to go tourist-wise with kids (except for attractions by The Vatican which we took the train to) was very easily accessible by foot. The taxi driver on our way to the Hotel said we couldn't have picked a better location for all the sights. About 10 metres from the front entrance as you are heading left is a friendly little eatery that serves all manner of Italian favourites. Cheap and cheery, and highly recommended. Breakfast at the hotel was good - not flash, but completely met our needs with a range of cakes and pastries, yoghurt, cold meats, juices, toast. Only criticism is that a little music (even having a local radio station playing over the sound system) would have made this area feel a bit friendlier - everyone is eating in silence and you feel the need to be very quiet which can be a challenge with kids. Front desk and service staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Be VERY Careful when Booking this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: oswel
Reviews.Content: I tried booking this hotel, which has great reviews, through the various web sites that came up through Tripadvisor's links. Travelocity had the best deal, so I booked through them. When I got my confirmation, I realized I had been led to another property with a similar name: Fori Imperiale Apartments. I immediately tried to cancel the reservation because I wanted a hotel, not an apartment, but I was told by Travelocity that the apartment did not allow cancellations! Essentially, I'd lose the $1300 I paid for two rooms for three nights each. I ended up staying there so as not to lose the money. The units were fine, but I was deceived by the owner into leaving my one-bedroom unit after my first night so "it could be repaired" and moved into a smaller studio. All in all, a very unpleasant experience. Just make sure when you book the Fori Imperiale Cavalieri that you're getting the hotel and not an apartment. By the way, there are several apartments by that name. The one I had problems with was handled by Rome Sweet Home, with a key collection office on via della Vite 32. The actual unit is located at via dell' Archetto in the old section of town, not far from the Trevi Fountain. Again, it's not a bad unit, but just be sure you know what you're getting in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: EllisEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 days on our first ever visit to Rome. The location was fantastic!! They offered a transfer service from the airport which was very helpful. The staff are very helpful. We stayed in a Junior Suite which did feel slightly small to us, I am not sure what the standard Doubles are like. Great breakfast! We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to visit from this hotel, including Vatican City. The Colosseum was very very close. The bathroom was quite big and well appointed. The hotel had air conditioning which was great as it was quite hot in Italy. We were able to leave our luggage there after we checked out and were then able to collect it late in the evening. We were very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “will DEFINITELY be going back!”
Reviews.Author: danystorm
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel - fairly priced, very charming and clean, comfortable, quiet - and within a short walk of the best sights of ancient Rome. I stayed in seven different hotels in Rome this summer, on numerous trips, and when I discovered this one, I felt I'd finally found the perfect hotel. Since then, I have stayed here on three separate occasions, both with my daughter and by myself, and each time it was absolutely problem-free. The owners and staff are patient and helpful, the breakfasts were excellent. The neighborhood offers both touristy-type restaurants as well as more authentic local bars and eateries. You're also close to major bus stops and a subway line. The hotel itself is on a quiet, charming street, away from the noise. I'd recommend this place to anyone and will DEFINITELY be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Tall15
Reviews.Content: We originally tried to book the Cosmopolita, but found them impersonal and unhelpful with the booking process. With 3 days to go, we discovered that we didn't have a room when I double checked everything. We had initially discounted the Fori Imperiali as we are both smokers and it's a non-smoking hotel. However, we're very glad we went with them. We also had room 206 (junior suite with terrace) for less than the price of a standard double at the Cosmopolita. Whilst not huge, the room was more than adequate: it was clean, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom and shower a decent size. In fact, our only criticism would be the wobbly loo seat! Mini-bar prices are surprisingly reasonable. Breakfast was much better than we expected after our only other 3* experience: a good choice of cereal, yoghurt, cheese, meat, bread/toast, boiled eggs, cakes etc. You must try the cappucino and chocolate croissants! You'd have to be very picky not to find something you like. The staff are lovely; the lady on reception even phoned the shuttle company we booked to confirm the pick up time for us. The location is superb- it's just off Via Cavour, tucked back from the road on a one way street so isn't always easy for drivers to spot (check it on a map first) but it's ideally placed for all the sights. We only used the Metro to get to the Vatican (we recommend you avoid Saturday morning) but it's only 1 Euro a trip and fantastically easy to use. Overall, a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “charming family run hotel who makes & sales their own good wine”
Reviews.Author: lcbuncobroad
Reviews.Content: We loved staying in #206 with a private balcony & we were there for 10 days. Tthe waiter for the moning breakfast was the most delightful, friendly & helpful man. He helped us learn some Italian words & was so interesting to talk to! The hotel was actaully cleaner then most of Rome which has a lot of graffiti. We do not plan on returning to Rome but would stay at this hotel if it was someplace other then Rome. We did love the wine!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: dianed4444
Reviews.Content: Courteous, friendly staff--we felt very comfortable even with my limited Italian. I had a problem with my hairdryer & adapter that blew the fuses in our room. No problem; they immediately moved us to another room. The property was located very conveniently to the sites of ancient Rome. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location”
Reviews.Author: jec199
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly. Stayed in a single room on the third floor. Small room but comfortable. Cold air conditioning, user controlled. However, the bathroom was small. The shower was fine but the toilet and bidet are awkwardly placed. Parent's double room on the same floor had a shower and a bath tub with a small balcony. Breakfast was fantastic. Grocery store, restaurants and colliseum all very close by. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average value”
Reviews.Author: Heinlager
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic. It is down a little alley, but it is one block from the Colosseum and the Metro. You cannot get around Rome as a tourist without the Metro - the busses are rubbish and the taxis are ripoff merchants - the taxi from the train to the hotel (2 km) tried to charge us €15... We had several problems with the room but the main problem (the shower) was repaired during our stay (good news for you!) and we got a discount for this. The rooms are small, but here you are paying for location. 24 hr front desk, and a €50 limo to the airport was good too - when you see driving in Rome you will want that Mercedes with 57 airbags when you're going 140 kph on the motorway! Continental breakfast was OK if limited - I would say this hotel is 3 star as advertised. Getting around Rome - you can walk to the Colosseum, Forum etc from the hotel easily. Get a Metro for all other sites. Don't bother waiting and working busses out - the Metro is much better and €1 per trip. Just keep an eye on your wallet/handbag. In Rome tourist books say get away from the main sites if you want to avoid touristy restaurants - I recommend against this as you won't find any unless you know Rome. Suck it up and pay €40-60 for a good meal with a bottle of wine - very tasty! Try to find places that have Italians and don't go anywhere that is empty, has a guy trying to drag you in out front, or only has tourists - anywhere that locals are dining is fantastic! Just around the corner from the hotel on the main street there are 4-5 restaurants that do street dining under cover and they were lovely - probably tourist lovely but that was fine with us. Opposite the Spanish steps there is a narrow lane (1 block away from where all the designer stores are) and 150m down there we found another great place. Vatican lines were fine at 8.30am but awful around 11am. Go to the Museums first! The queue for St Peter's looks massive but moves fast!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: annapolitan99
Reviews.Content: My family and I (2 adults, 2 kids) stayed here in early June 08 for about 4 days for about 270 euro per night. We had one quad room which was a little cramped for the 4 of us, but was completely adequate, clean, with hot water for the shower. Hotel is well maintained and has a nice little roof terrace for enjoying wine in the evening. Breakfast was standard for Europe/Italy, perfectly fine. Hotel location is excellent for the Coloseum/Forum, OK for central rome (e.g., Pantheon), and a little too far from the Vatican, but we still walked everywhere. Overall, a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not much to look at, but clean, friendly, affordable!”
Reviews.Author: zagated
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel the last week of May 2008: single room 130 euros per night. My room had no view and was just a bed, a chair and a bathroom. Small tv and closet. But it was clean and totally quiet, and if you love ancient Rome you can't beat the location. It's across the street from the main entrace to the Roman Forum, tucked away on a quiet cobblestone backstreet off the east side of the Via Fori Imperiali. It's a 4 minute walk north from the Colosseo metro station. The staff were friendly and professional. Breakfast buffet from 7am to 10 am comes with the room, with boiled eggs and fruit and meats. There is an elevator. A traditional budget restaurant nearby is Osteria Nerone, up Nero's hill above the Colosseum. Another night I ate at Cafe La Biga, which directly overlooks the Colosseum. If you don't need anything fancy but just want a safe, simple, clean place to stay I recommend it. I would definitely stay here again, trying to get a slightly nicer looking room. I just hope it doesnt upgrade and turn into some unaffordable boutique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: DivaOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific, reasonably-priced place to stay. I would have given it five stars but the one flaw was that the beds were hard. This was solved by requesting more pillows, which were provided immediately. The hotel is clean, quiet, very-well maintained and very close to a lot of the things you want to see as a tourist in Rome. At this place, you are just steps away from the Forum and Colosseum, and it's a quick walk to the Metro. The breakfast that's provided in the morning is just enough to get you out the door with some energy. I would absolutely stay here again, and highly recommend it. This was my second trip to Rome. Like in most mid-priced places in Italy, the shower stalls are small, so just take that into account. I really did like this place a lot and am glad to have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with beautiful views, yet horrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: ginrn1111
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights that were terrible! I must first say the benefit was the location, the roof top view was incredible at night (when they would actually let you up there), and Pietro who served breakfast and drinks. Pietro was very kind and so helpful to all of us. To start off, we were told that there was ample parking for us. Were in a group with 9 cars. Well, were were stuck in their alley way blocking cars that were none to pleased with us. This was the unpleasant end to trying to locate the hotel. After no help from the hotel, we located places to park around/near the hotel. The next day we checked on the cars only to find that 2 of them had been towed. The hotel made a phone call in which they were not willing to translate! Lucky for us we had someone in our group that spoke fluent Italian. $600 US dollars later we got them back. Check in was very confusing and the gentleman did not seem to care for Americans. He seemed to be very demeaning at every opportunity throughout our stay. We learned not to ask him for anything! Our room was a triple that was very cramped but a pretty room. The view from the room was the gorgeous! The last day that we were there the group began talking and realized that all of us had noticed mysterious bites on us....bed bugs!!! Yes, bed bugs! We spoke with the front desk with no attempt to assist us or concern. One member of the group also had a necklace stolen from the room while we were gone to dinner. We were gone about 2 hours at the fabulous restaurant around the corner! Nonetheless, we abruptly checked out and contacted our hotel in Sorrento and took off. We didn't care if we had to pay for the last night or not. I do not recommend this hotel at all unless changes have been made. It took 3 weeks and medication to treat the bites. I loved seeing the Vatican, roman forum, and coliseum yet I wish we would have known all of this before hand.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amneris
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel. The room was small but very clean and nice. The staff was very friendly, breakfast was well above average Italian "continental breakfast" and the roof terrace was a bonus item. The location was excellent. Colosseum and Forum Romanum were just few steps away and other sites either within walk distance or easily accessible by metro. The hotel was on a quiet street and the traffic noices didn't bother at all. When the window was closed it was absolutely quiet inside. If I ever go to Rome again, I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Next to the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: Clilpup
Reviews.Content: We stayed our first night in Rome at the Grand Palazzo Carpegna near the Vatican City. Although, the Grand was a much nicer hotel, I liked Fori Imperiali better because it is central to everything. You basically walk out of the hotel front door and see the Colosseum, Forum, and Palazzo Venezia. Our room was a bit small, but surprisingly the bathroom was quite large comparatively. We were out most of the day exploring, so the room didn't really matter to me since it was really just a place to sleep...It was clean and had a TV, that is all that mattered to me at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, the location is greatest asset to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pniffer
Reviews.Content: My husband son and I stayed here for 4 nights at the end of a cruise. I had read up on the reviews before we went. I was disappointed in the immediate environs of the hotel, in back streets which are covered in graffiti. The hotel itself was not as smart as the photos online suggest either. My first impressions of our 4th floor room was that it was small and adequate but by no means luxurious. Maybe I was influenced by the fact that we had just come from a 5* cruise ship, but even so........... There is a tiny sitting area in front of a bar, just by reception, and a small seated area for the breakfast buffet. The "roof garden" was a great disappointment. It was a covered paved seated area, very small with views of the residential backstreet area around. I had hoped to sit up there to read or have a pre dinner drink, and to enjoy the sun, but having seen it I gave that idea a miss. The cold buffet was adequate, one type of sliced cheese, slices of one type of ham, croissants, cakes, cereal, two juices, nice coffee, sometimes fresh fruit. On our first night, the air conditioning failed so we opened the windows in an attempt to cool down. I was unable to cope with the heat and street noise and eventually went to reception at midnight to plead for another room. I was given one, and the air con was sort of fixed over the next few days . We weren't offered any compensation for the inconvenience. The location in Rome for the tourist is by far the advantage of this hotel. It is literally 2-3 minutes from the Colusseum and the Roman Forum and well placed for the underground station. I would stay here again for a short budget break. I wish my expectations had not been as high, really.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: wak92107
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night in June. It was a little hard to find at first, as we walked from the train station, but we did eventually find the place. FYI, it is off of Via Cavour, a major street in this part of town; use it as a point of reference. This was our first experience with any hotel in Italy, as we had just flown into Rome from the states. Hotel rooms are a bit small, but no different from our experiences in either London or Greece. The showers, but this was the same everywhere in Italy unless there was a bathtub, are small. I am a small girl and I wouldn't plan on shaving my legs in this shower. All the bathrooms in Italy have a string on the wall next to or in the shower. We didn't know what this was for until we asked our B&B owner in Venice. She said that Italian law requires all hotels, etc. to have them to pull in case one falls down and needs assistance. So do not pull the string unless you need hotel assistance! The breakfast was typical; Croissants, yogurt, meats, cheeses and cereal. There was a barista that made excellent cappuccinos. We each had two. We were in Italy for a wedding, but came early to make the trip a vacation. The wedding was at the end of the trip, therefore we were required to carry my husband's suit, dress shoes, shirts, etc. and well as my dresses and shoes not only the wedding but the rehearsal dinner around for the entire portion of our trip. The morning after our stay when packing up our stuff, I failed to look under the bed and did not pack my husbands very expensive dress shoes. We did not realize this until 2 days later after a lovely stay in Tuscany. I was packing our bags to leave for Florence and realized we were missing the shoes. My husband was able to contact the hotel and they held the shoes they found in our room. We were heading back through Rome on our way to the Almalfi Coast a few days later from Venice. Needless to say, he ran from the train station in the intense heat to the hotel and they gave him his shoes. I was very impressed the shoes were still there. It was really nice to be in a foreign country and experience a trustworthy establishment. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again. Check out the rooftop lounging area. Bring up your own drinks and enjoy the outdoors. You can flip to a channel on your TV and view the rooftop. My husband was able to watch me hang out up there from our room. Overall, nice people and an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a couple of gripes”
Reviews.Author: SteveGapper
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at this hotel over the May bank holiday weekend 2006. We found it clean with generally friendly staff and in a great location. We walked just about everywhere. The hotel offered to arrange for us to met at the airport for €60 which worked well. Very nice Merc people carrier. We asked them to book us a return trip the day before we left. An old Ford Transit type van turned up with some bench seats. As the trip was only 30/40 minutes we put up with it. When we got to the airport the driver said he wanted €70. We refused and offered only €60. He threatened to get the police but we paid €60 and just walked away. Not a pleasant end to a great holiday. Check the price when booking! The other gripe is my fault. The invoice was presented with two amounts on it, one in Euros which was the price I booked at and a second in £ sterling. I checked that the Euro amount was correct and didn't read any further. On getting home and checking the credit card receipt I see that I paid in £ sterling at the exchange rate given to me by the hotel. This is a worse rate than I would have got from my credit card company had I paid in Euros. I feel a bit cheated but have only myself to blame - I should have insisted on paying in Euros. Be aware!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, worth the stay!”
Reviews.Author: IsabellaM
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my husband and baby in September. This hotel is worth reccommending. It is small and fairly basic but the rooms are pretty decent and the breakfast is quite good. Its also in a good location - just a stone's throw from the Colleseum.

Reviews.Title: “Oof. Wouldn't do that again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and the best thing I can say about it is that it is close to lots of attractions. However, the staff was completely unhelpful and the room was dirty and rundown. For the money, it was definitely not worth it. At least it was close to things so we could stay out of the hotel as much as possible. Yuck. I would not stay here again or recommend anyone else do so.

Reviews.Title: “ideal situation”
Reviews.Author: hergest
Reviews.Content: just returned from a week here with my wife and 12 yr old daughter, and had an excellent stay. the room was as described, maybe a bit on the small side for 3 of us but served the purpose of being an ideal place to relax in. air conditioning was a godsend aswell! location was in a nice quiet backstreet very close to the collosseum and metro. staff were friendly, breakfast was enough to keep us going until mid afternoon and the happy hour at the irish bar just down the street lasted most of the daytime! all in all i would say a good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to start at the beginning of our trip. We were advised to book a car through the hotel, which we did and which worked out very well as it is cheaper and more comfortable than a cab. When we arrived at 11 am on Sunday one of our rooms, (we traveled with another couple) was ready and we were able to change and shower. The location is incredible. A few minute walk down a back alley to the Colosseum and Fori Imperiali as well to the Piazza Venezia (climb the stairs to the top of this monument as the view is one of the best in Rome). The map supplied at the hotel site looks bigger than the area really is so everything in that map is within a 10 minute walk. There is a Taxi stand at the Piazza Venezia and at 8 am the Vatican is a 6 Euro trip for four. The metro station is also handy for those that want the expericance of crushed travel. There are excellent Trattorias (inexpensive family run restaurants) on Via Corvour, just through a connecting alley as well as a small fruit store where bottled water, wine and pop is cheap. Most Trattorias and Restaurants except all credit cards but tipping is in cash. The Shamrock pub is around the corner and well worth popping your head in to say hello, the owner speaks English and can save you some time and money over a pint of Harp. (We made it our local and had a pint or two everyday so say the Canadians sent you) The reason I go on to explain the location in detail is to point out the fact that the location is excellent and made the trip. The hotel staff were very friendly and very helpful with arranging airport transportation as well as a couple of tours. The rooms are exactly what you see in the pictures. The rooms are quiet with an excellent (and noiseless) air conditioner and clean. We had the Superior double pictures and the other couple had a large terrace room. The only issue we had was with the size of the shower. The bathroom was large but showers in most of the hotels are unusually small. It wasn’t a big issue, however if you are 300 lbs you may want to consider making that known before you go. There is a very private roof top terrace which we took advantage of so reserving a terrace room really doesn’t seem to be of advantage. The breakfast is like most served in Rome, boiled eggs, cakes, cereals, juice, hams, toast, cappuccino, espresso or tea. We had a chance to look at other hotels both 2 star and 3 star in the area and really found this the best of the bunch. The fact it is in one of the alleyways (see picture) makes for a nice quiet sleep while still affording you the advantage of an excellent location. I would recommend this hotel and gladly stay again. Feel free to email me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “stay away: dirty and expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shelly293984
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights from 23 april 2005. All that period they did not clean the floor of the room ! They only clean the bathroom. They replaced the sheets of the bed only twice. The room was extremely small. There where no electric sockets for charging batteries, cellular telepfones, digital cameras ect. We felt like poor people in our holiday. The breakfast is dull. And for all of this inconvenience we paid 350 $ for a day !! unbeliveable!! We tried desperately to find another hotel, but we can not succeeded because all the 3 stars hotels were sold out due to the new pope's ceremony, which attract so many tourists from all over the world. the only positive thing about this hotel : it has an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “For a 3 stars hotel this is a good choice & location is great!”
Reviews.Author: xleo68
Reviews.Content: Location: is very good, you can walk all Rome from here, the Colloseum, Forum and Piazza Venezia are just 5 minutes away, Fontana Trevi 10 min, Piazza Spagna and Navona 15 to 20 min, 15 min from Termini train station... but is also easy, fast and cheap to move around by bus... Staff: nice and kind attention at reception and bar Rooms: hey! this is Europe and Rome, don't expect the same big, confortable and modern rooms as you could find for the same or less price in the US, If you want better you will have to spend a lot more here in Rome!, remember this is a 3 stars hotel, but considering all you get a clean room, a bit small but confortable enough, new and silent air conditioning, new and clean bathroom. Rooms are very quiet since hotel is away from main streets. I would say is OK, all you need for a decent good sleep, anyway you will be out walking all day and night too! Breakfast: simple, mainly continental, was ok for me The City: there are 2 faces of Rome: one is the Ancient city, you can feel and breath history here! Exceptional monuments and fountains, don´t you miss a thing! starring at Fountain Trevi for example is just a joy! I stayed 3 days and visited everything including the Vatican, until my feet hurt but it was wothwhile! On the other hand expect bad and rude service at restaurants and bars and even at stores, even bad talking behind your back (I'm half italian and hurts to say this but is what I experienced), don't even dare to ask to try a bite of an icecream in any Gelateria, you will get bad looks for saying the least, just buy the deam ice cream (which are usually very good). The city seems a bit messy and desorganized too. For all that I might never go to Rome again. Ironically good service is given by non italians, for example Argentinians, met some in restaurants and bars in Rome, Verona and Florence and were all very opened and nice. Food in general is good as in all Italy, enjoy a good pasta and drink good red wine, you will feel like an Emperor!!! Visit the Time Elevator, a movie style atraction story telling of Rome, it is close to piazza Venezia but seems that very few people know of it. It is spoken in 6 languages and children will like it but adults too. Finally, the Fori Imperiali Cavalieri is a good choice, wouldn't say excelent, there could be other better options around, but overall ok, location is great, attention is good: recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A charming hotel tucked away from the noisy city streets. We stayed three nights and reserved a triple room for my three adult childrend and a double for us. They were both very spacious and clean. We really enjoyed the breakfast, there was something for everyone. The staff was very helpful especially getting us reservations for some tours. We especially liked the location and walked to most everything and the subway was just around the corner which we took advantage of. (it was very very crowded so be careful with pickpockets, keep your hand on your wallets) We took advantage of the many restuarants in the area and were not disappointed. We would recommend this hotel and if we ever got the opportunity to go back we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Chose this place at random and didn't regret it! (May 2004)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent position 5 minutes walk from the Collosseum and even less to the Forum, but tucked away down a quiet side street. Traffic noise is not a problem. Clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff, good continental breakfast. Small bar and very small terrace on the roof. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “sweet boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: mpoggg
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Cavalieri last year. Great staff was helpful in all ways including making dinner reservations. Quiet location, a little hard to find if you are driving as I was. Breakfast above average and rooms spacious and very clean.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Fori Imperiali Cavalieri
HotelInfo.Address: Via Frangipane, 34, 00184 Rome, Italy
